mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from Nephew to Uncle inquiring about possible employment
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A letter dated May 20, 1869 from a Nephew inquiring of his Uncle if he may have possible employment as a Clerk in his store. He writes that "I am out of employment as Jake has rented the farm for this year." The letter closes with "I remain your affectionate Nephew untill death.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Clerks
Employment
Salesclerks
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
